posts.title: Driving/Rain
posts.excerpt: Shot with a cell-phone camera, focuses on the sound of rain and visuals of pretty, multicolored lights blurred in a watery car window.

posts.title: Entr’acte
posts.excerpt: An absolute surrealistic movie. Somebody gets killed, his coffin gets out of control and after a surrealistic chase it stops. The person gets out of it and let everybody who followed the coffin disapear.

posts._title: Ann Hui – Laam yan sei sap AKA July Rhapsody (2002)
posts.title: Laam yan sei sap
posts.excerpt: Yiu-Kwok is a high school teacher, having a perfect family. Good times don’t last long, when a student, Choy-Nam, falls in love with him. For dealing with a relationship with Mr. Seng, a beloved teacher of the couple, his wife Man-Ching requests a leave for a month. A midlife crisis mixing with pressure sends him …

posts._title: Joe Gibbons – Confessions of a Sociopath (2002)
posts.title: Confessions of a Sociopath
posts.excerpt: Confessions of a Sociopath is a 60-minute autobiographical film on digital video and Super 8 film, conceived as a real-life version of Beckett’s Krapp’s Last Tape. In this film, Joe Gibbons plays a fictionalized version of himself as he discovers a roomful of Super 8 footage from his own life, detailing events he can no …

posts._title: Paul Morrissey – Heat AKA Andy Warhol’s Heat (1972)
posts.title: Heat
posts.excerpt: From Amos Vogel’s Film as a Subversive Art:A bizarre, yet mild version of “Sunset Boulevard” a la Warhol, with a bevy of voracious females of varying proportions vying for the casual favors of a passive Joe Dallesandro. The dialogue is fresh, simple, funny, as is the relaxed, improvised acting. Fellatio and demythologized sex make their …

posts._title: Márta Mészáros – Eltávozott nap AKA The girl aka The day has gone (1968)
posts.title: Eltávozott nap
posts.excerpt: A young woman leaves a state orphanage to find her mother in this interesting examination ofhow the overt repression of women in the older pattern of village life has been replaced bythe more subtle sexual and economic exploitation inherent in the apparently freer existenceof young girls in the contemporary city. A key film from Marta …
posts.titleEnglish: The girl aka The day has gone

posts._title: Claude Chabrol – La cérémonie AKA A Judgement in Stone [Carlotta 4K Restoration] (1995)
posts.title: La cérémonie
posts.excerpt: A newly hired maid for a rich countryside family befriends a post-office clerk who encourages her to rebel against her employers.

posts._title: Vojtech Jasný – Ansichten eines Clowns AKA The Clown (1976)
posts.title: Ansichten eines Clowns
posts.excerpt: Hans Schnier has earned his living as a clown, though he is in fact a very covert sort of social critic. After enduring a difficult childhood in Bonn during the Second World War, including his mother’s fanatic Nazism, he is appalled to discover many of the people he knows and loves swept deeply into involvement …

posts._title: Paul Morrissey – Trash AKA Andy Warhol’s Trash (1970)
posts.title: Trash
posts.excerpt: From Amos Vogel’s Film as a Subversive Art:A high-camp “love story” of an outrageously handsome heroin junkie and his trash-scavenging girlfriend (played by a female impersonator), this film skips from fellatio to seduction to foot fetishism in its attacks on soap opera myths and Hollywood. A playful perversity, an acceptance of the soft underbelly of …

posts._title: Niels Arden Oplev – To verdener AKA Worlds Apart (2008)
posts.title: To verdener
posts.excerpt: Sara, the daughter of a Jehovah’s Witness, is forced to choose between religion and love when she falls for someone outside her faith. This film is based on a true story. It is one of the finest films I have seen on the Jehovah’s Witnesses and social control. In the last scene, the girl in …
